revised_title: Multipolar Susceptibility Formalism for Magnetic Shielding in Non-Spherical Molecules
tldr: The article presents a multipolar susceptibility formalism for interpreting and mapping the isotropic magnetic shielding outside non-spherical molecules. The method involves spheroidal harmonic expansions of the local magnetic fields, providing more accurate descriptions of magnetic shielding for non-spherical molecules than previous methods. This formalism is particularly relevant for molecules with prolate or oblate shapes, such as acetylene, helical polymers, benzene, and metalloporphyrins.
